verses.text: A false balance \add is\add* abomination to the LORD: but a just weight \add is\add* his delight.
\add When\add* pride cometh, then cometh shame: but with the lowly \add is\add* wisdom.
The integrity of the upright shall guide them: but the perverseness of transgressors shall destroy them.
Riches profit not in the day of wrath: but righteousness delivereth from death.
The righteousness of the perfect shall direct his way: but the wicked shall fall by his own wickedness.
The righteousness of the upright shall deliver them: but transgressors shall be taken in \add their own\add* naughtiness.
When a wicked man dieth, \add his\add* expectation shall perish: and the hope of unjust \add men\add* perisheth.
The righteous is delivered out of trouble, and the wicked cometh in his stead.
A hypocrite with \add his\add* mouth destroyeth his neighbor: but through knowledge shall the just be delivered.
When the righteous prosper, the city rejoiceth: and when the wicked perish, \add there is\add* shouting.
By the blessing of the upright the city is exalted: but it is overthrown by the mouth of the wicked.
He that is void of wisdom despiseth his neighbor: but a man of understanding holdeth his peace.
A tale-bearer revealeth secrets: but he that is of a faithful spirit concealeth the matter.
Where no counsel \add is\add* , the people fall: but in the multitude of counselors \add there is\add* safety.
He that is surety for a stranger shall smart \add for it\add* : and he that hateth suretiship is sure.
A gracious woman retaineth honor: and strong \add men\add* retain riches.
The merciful man doeth good to his own soul: but \add he that is\add* cruel troubleth his own flesh.
The wicked worketh a deceitful work: but to him that soweth righteousness \add shall be\add* a sure reward.
As righteousness \add tendeth\add* to life: so he that pursueth evil \add pursueth it\add* to his own death.
They that are of a froward heart \add are\add* abomination to the LORD: but \add such as are\add* upright in \add their\add* way \add are\add* his delight.
\add Though\add* hand \add join\add* in hand, the wicked shall not be unpunished: but the seed of the righteous shall be delivered.
\add As\add* a jewel of gold in a swine's snout, \add so is\add* a fair woman who is without discretion.
The desire of the righteous \add is\add* only good: \add but\add* the expectation of the wicked \add is\add* wrath.
There is that scattereth, and yet increaseth; and \add there is\add* that withholdeth more than is meet, but \add it tendeth\add* to poverty.
The liberal soul shall be made fat: and he that watereth shall be watered also himself.
He that withholdeth corn, the people shall curse him: but blessing \add shall be\add* upon the head of him that selleth \add it\add* .
He that diligently seeketh good procureth favor: but he that seeketh mischief, it shall come to him.
He that trusteth in his riches shall fall: but the righteous shall flourish as a branch.
He that troubleth his own house shall inherit the wind: and the fool \add shall be\add* servant to the wise of heart.
The fruit of the righteous \add is\add* a tree of life; and he that winneth souls \add is\add* wise.
Behold, the righteous shall be recompensed upon the earth: much more the wicked and the sinner.
